value.title: DeepMind co-founder leaves Google after a rocky tenure.
value.excerpt: Mustafa Suleyman, who played a key role in the company’s work on health care technology, is joining Greylock Partners, a Silicon Valley venture capital firm.

value.title: The IRS will start using facial recognition this summer — and you'll have to send off a selfie if you want to pay your taxes online
value.excerpt: "You won't be able to log in with your existing IRS username and password starting in summer 2022," the IRS said, as spotted by a security blogger.

value.title: Windows 11 is making it easier to control your PC with your voice
value.excerpt: Windows 11 Insiders on the Dev Channel can now test the new voice access features. There's other improvement in the latest build, too.

value.title: McKinsey donates machine learning pipeline tool Kedro to the Linux Foundation
value.excerpt: Kedro, a machine learning model tool originally developed by McKinsey's QuantumBlack, has been donated to the Linux Foundation.

value.title: IRS Will Require Facial Recognition Scans to Access Your Taxes
value.excerpt: Users will have to submit sensitive government documents, their social security number, credit history, and a facial scan to third-party company ID.me.

value.title: 5 ways AI and ML will improve cybersecurity in 2022
value.excerpt: Improving cybersecurity from the endpoint to the core of IT infrastructures needs to be every enterprise's goal in 2022.

value.title: BrainChip Achieves Full Commercialisation of AKD1000 AIoT Chip
value.excerpt: BrainChip Holdings Ltd, today announced that it has begun taking orders for the first commercially available Mini PCIe board leveraging its AkidaT advanced neural networking processor, rounding out its suite of AKD1000 offerings.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence Can Help Leaders Drive Global Economy Forward In 2022

value.title: How Artificial Intelligence Services Can Help Small Businesses
value.excerpt: Now, with sophisticated AI tools more accessible and affordable than ever, retailers have new ways to improve customer experiences, augment staffing and streamline their business processes.

value.title: Ambient’s computer vision detects dangerous behaviors, but raises privacy concerns
value.excerpt: Ambient, which is using computer vision to develop security systems, is emerging from stealth. But its software raises privacy concerns.

value.title: StructionSite raises $10 million to apply AI to construction project management
value.excerpt: StructionSite, a startup developing a platform that monitors construction sites using computer vision, has raised $10 million.

value.title: Public Relations and Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: In the past 25 years there have been few disruptive forces broad enough to impact every corner of the public relations field. As practitioners, we have seen the advent of the Internet and email change the way we communicate with journalists and our other constituents.

value.title: The Opportunity And The Danger Of Artificial Intelligence At Retail
value.excerpt: Technology is creating a new era of decision-making in retail but it's not clear that it will always be good. Now is the time for the industry to act.

value.title: Bank of America’s latest AI and machine learning product, CashPro Forecasting
value.excerpt: The debut of CashPro Forecasting, an artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) cash flow forecasting tool, by Bank of America was announced on Friday. It creates accurate financial projections using machine learning models based on a company’s cash flow history.

value.title: Customers Know How To Solve Data, Privacy And AI Trust Issues. Brands Should Listen To Them
value.excerpt: New research provides clues as to how brands should respond to customers feelings about data, privacy and the use of artificial intelligence (AI).

value.title: Why games may not be the best benchmark for AI
value.excerpt: Games have long been used as a benchmark in AI, but not all experts are convinced that they're the right goalposts for research.
